Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk ipa-client
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: ipa bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: Red Hat Identity Management (IdM) is a centralized authentication, identity management, and authorization solution for both traditional and cloud-based enterprise environments. Prior to this update, the bind packages were missing certain patches required by the bind-dyndb-ldap system plug-in. Consequently, the "named" service failed. To fix this bug, correct version of the bind packages has been used when installing bind-dyndb-ldap. As a result, correct bind package is installed. (BZ#1469978) Previously, when installing IdM replica, the installer incorrectly set the location and permissions of temporary directories. The IdM management framework requires these temporary directories to operate correctly. As a consequence, after rebooting the newly configured replica, the services tied to the management framework did not work and displayed non-specific error messages. To fix this bug, the installer now additionally adds a drop-in configuration file that re-creates the directory structure after rebooting. As a result, the IdM replica continues to work correctly after reboot. (BZ#1470125) Users of ipa are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
